title: cafter
author: cafter
content: many times i seen users telling "this campaign will end on this date and time on forum time" but where i can see the forum time?when seeing in my profile it written local time, and seeing other user's profile it shows another local time. but the local time do not match with my country time.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Op, the forum time is located on the top right part of the forum. I checked other users too and confirmed that the local time is same for them all. I guess both the local time and forum time displays same thing.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on September 13, 2023, 11:52:49 AM<...>In your profile, under Look and Layout Preferences, you’ll see an option to set the time offset with regards to the "forum time". You can adjust it there to meet your country’s timezone (*): https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3526239;sa=theme (link that will work just for the OP)The "forum time" shown in the caption in the above said screen states that it is currently September 13, 2023, 12:04, which is UTC (forum time is therefore UTC).(*) i.e. New Delhi is UTC+5:30, which requires you to type 5.5 in the offset field.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on September 13, 2023, 11:52:49 AMmany times i seen users telling "this campaign will end on this date and time on forum time" but where i can see the forum time?The forum time is UTC time zone as shown by DdmrDdmr, so manually checking it and comparing it with your local time will help you to get it. But be careful not all campaign managers actually uses the UTC time zone some make use of the CET time zone Example is Hhampuz. The CET time zone is two hours ahead of the UTC time zone. Compare the two with with your local time zone to get the right idea of it. If you’re confuse just goggle it

The forum time may not have to work with your own local time in your country, what i expect from you is to know that the forum has the same time which you can view if you're on the forum regardless of the board you're, just look up by the right hand side and there you see the forum time and date, you can also view through your profile, you also can check under your profile look and preference and adjust to your own local time if you want.

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on September 13, 2023, 11:52:49 AMmany times i seen users telling "this campaign will end on this date and time on forum time" but where i can see the forum time?when seeing in my profile it written local time, and seeing other user's profile it shows another local time. but the local time do not match with my country time. Forum time is subject because you can change it base on the time zone you preferred. You should pay attention on the time zone given by the campaign manager to make sure you are using the correct time format. The default forum time on my account when I created is UTC but some manager use different time zone so you can adjust it on your Look and Layout Preference on your profile.

Compare the two with with your local time zone to get the right idea of it. If you’re confuse just goggle it If you are in the signature campaign, it is always advisable to set the timezone according to what your respective manager uses for the cut off time of the posts. For Example, I am in the campaign managed by Hhampuz so I have set my time Offset as +2, in order to meet the CET Time zone.In this way, you will never have problems in post counting as your forum time will tele with your's campaign manager's time set for the weekly posts deadline time.

If you're too lazy you can also check your post and see the timestamp when it was registered on the forum (assuming you never touch the timezone setting). CMIIW.
